intro: Sedum telephium var. praecelsum, commonly known as the Crimson Blazing Campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is adapted to harsh, cold climates. Its vibrant flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
